means: 篡改，伪造( falsify的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The new discoveries have falsified that hypothesis.
sentence.Network_cn: 新的发现已证明那个假定是无根据的.

sentence.Network_en: He has falsified in his answer.
Her speech in Parliament was falsified by the newspapers.
sentence.Network_cn: 她在议会里的发言被报纸歪曲了.

PerfectNetExp.abs: I know , of course , that the past is falsified , but it would never be possible for me to prove it , even when I did the falsification myself .当然啦，我知道过去被他们篡改，可是我没法证明，即便我着手篡改的时候也做不到。

between 2008 and 2009 employment histories of more than 200 Chinese commercial pilots were found to have been falsified , with some of them embellishing their flying histories .《悉尼晨报》、法新社等报导称，伊春空难原因可能是飞行员的错误操作。在2008-2009年期间，查出约有200多名中国商业飞行员伪造简历，一些人虚构了其飞行经
造假帐 falsified accounts 增值税 value added tax(VAT) 渣打银行 The Chartered Bank 债台高筑 become debt-ridden债转股 debt-to-equity swap 招标invite a.
falsificationism 否证论, falsified 被虚伪化, falsifications 证伪

list.abs: ...★ falsify（vt）alter falsely 窜改（如文件）；伪造；falsify records 伪造记录（vt）present sth falsely 歪曲（某事物）
positivism 实证主义potential falsifier 潜在证伪者prescience 前科学

scholars , and Western , say that fraud remains rampant and misconduct ranges from falsified data to fibs about degrees , cheating on tests and extensive plagiarism .中西方学者都指出，中国的学术造假情况依然十分猖獗，从伪造数据，谎报学历到考试作弊，大肆剽窃，可谓无所不在。
not to destroy or falsify evidence or tally confessions ., 不得毁灭 , 伪造证据或者串供.

entry.def: If someone falsifies something, they change it or add untrue details to it in order to deceive people.

example.ex: The charges against him include fraud, bribery, and falsifying business records.
example.tran: 对他的指控包括诈骗、行贿和伪造商业记录。

auth_sentence.content: Hypotheses that cannot be falsified belong to pseudo-science.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: They had mythologised his past and falsified his present.

auth_sentence.content: For example the falsified claim that vaccine preservatives cause autism.
